intro: Brunellia sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous small seeds. Brunellia sandwicensis plays an important ecological role in Hawaiian ecosystems, providing food and habitat for native wildlife.
